title: Recreate Purwanchal Job Center portal from screenshots with Internet Identity login, user profiles/onboarding, and admin CMS

requirements.text: Recreate the public landing page and overall layout to match the provided screenshots (header with logo + site name/subtitle, contact info strip, three feature cards, and a centered login/get-started card), keeping the same visual theme (light background, soft card shadows, blue accents, rounded containers).

quotes: look at this website and make this fully functional website inclusing all the featrures in the picture and the logo is atached at last picture
Do what you can keeping the theme same

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page visually matches the screenshot structure: top header area with logo and title, contact info strip, 3 feature cards (Job Seekers, Employers, Career Growth), and Get Started login card.
Responsive behavior works on narrow screens (cards stack, header stays readable).

requirements.text: Add static asset handling for the uploaded logo and use it in the header/hero as shown in the screenshots.

quotes: the logo is atached at last picture

acceptanceCriteria: Uploaded logo file is placed under frontend/public/assets/ (or similar static public path) and rendered in the header/hero in a circular/contained presentation similar to screenshots.
Logo renders crisply without layout shift.

requirements.text: Implement working authentication using Internet Identity for regular users (job seekers) including login and logout flows from the UI elements shown (Sign In with Internet Identity, Logout).

quotes: make sure all he l=login option works as well.

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Sign In with Internet Identity” authenticates the user and returns them to the app in an authenticated state.
Authenticated UI shows user name/role area and a working Logout button.
Unauthenticated users cannot access authenticated routes (e.g., dashboard tabs) and are redirected to the landing/login area.

requirements.text: Create and persist a per-user profile record keyed by the authenticated Principal; on first login, require the user to complete an onboarding flow to enter their personal details before accessing the main dashboard.

quotes: Create a profile for every login person and also let them enter every details about themselves after logging in for first time.

acceptanceCriteria: On first login, the user is routed to an onboarding form instead of the dashboard until required profile fields are completed.
After onboarding, the user can view and edit their profile from a Profile tab/route.
Profile data persists across refresh and re-login (stored in the Motoko canister).

requirements.text: Implement the authenticated user dashboard navigation and pages shown in the screenshots: Browse Jobs, My Applications, Messages, Updates, and Profile.

quotes: make this fully functional website inclusing all the featrures in the picture

acceptanceCriteria: Dashboard includes a tabbed navigation matching the screenshot labels: Browse Jobs, My Applications, Messages, Updates, Profile.
Each tab routes to a dedicated view and loads data via React Query from backend methods.
Empty states are implemented (e.g., “No jobs available at the moment” in Browse Jobs).

requirements.text: Implement job vacancy data model and user-facing Browse Jobs experience including search, listing, vacancy detail view, and the ability for a user to apply for a job and see their applications in My Applications.

quotes: including all the featrures in the picture

acceptanceCriteria: Jobs can be fetched and displayed in Browse Jobs with a search input filtering by title and/or company.
A job detail view shows the full vacancy information.
A logged-in user can apply to a vacancy; the application is persisted and appears in My Applications.
Users can only see their own applications.

requirements.text: Implement an Updates/Posts feature visible to users (Updates tab) where admins can publish posts/announcements and users can view a chronological list.
acceptanceCriteria: Users can view a list of updates/posts with title, content, and created date (and optional image if provided).
Backend persists posts and returns them ordered newest-first.

requirements.text: Implement an in-app Messages feature (Messages tab) supporting at minimum admin-to-user messaging (broadcast or per-user) and user-to-admin messages, with a simple inbox thread/list UI.

quotes: including all the featrures in the picture

acceptanceCriteria: Users can send a message to admin; admin can reply or broadcast messages.
Users can view message history in Messages tab.
Backend enforces that users can only read their own messages; admins can read all messages.

requirements.text: Implement an admin authentication/authorization path (“Admin Login”) and role-based access control so admin users have full control over the system while regular users cannot access admin features.

quotes: And for admin givre all the access and authority and control like adding vacancies deleting adding pictures, posts and all.

acceptanceCriteria: UI includes an “Admin Login” entry point as shown on the login card.
Backend has an admin allowlist mechanism (e.g., stored principals) and checks admin status on all admin-only methods.
Non-admin users cannot access admin routes or call admin methods (backend rejects with an error).

requirements.text: Build an admin panel that allows admins to create, edit, and delete vacancies; create, edit, and delete posts/updates; and add/delete/manage pictures used in posts/updates or site content.

quotes: adding vacancies deleting adding pictures, posts and all

acceptanceCriteria: Admin panel has CRUD UI for Vacancies and Posts/Updates.
Admin can upload/add an image for a post (with a clear size/type limit) and delete images that are no longer needed.
Admin changes are reflected immediately in user-facing pages after refresh (and via refetch).

requirements.text: Create a coherent visual theme matching the screenshots across all pages (typography, spacing, card style, buttons, neutral backgrounds with blue accents) and apply it consistently using Tailwind.

quotes: Do what you can keeping the theme same

acceptanceCriteria: All main views (Landing, Dashboard tabs, Admin panel) share consistent card styling, spacing, and blue-accent UI.
No default/unstyled placeholder UI remains in primary flows.

constraints: Backend must be implemented as a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).

Do not edit immutable frontend paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).
Use Internet Identity as the only authentication mechanism (no third-party auth providers).
All user-facing text in the app must be in English.
nonGoals: Integrating third-party social media APIs beyond simple outbound share links.
Real-time messaging via WebSockets (use request/refresh based messaging).
